tasks.task: Adhere to biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock or poultry.
subtasks: Identify the designated entry point on the farm or ranch.
Contact the farm or ranch for permission and obtain necessary phone number or sign-in information.
Prepare vehicle for inspection by the farmer or rancher upon arrival.
Clean and disinfect the truck and trailer if necessary, or follow direction to do so at designated facilities.
Sign in at the premises and provide necessary contact information if required.
Follow specified route provided by the farmer or rancher.
Examine required paperwork (CVI, certificate of brand inspection, bill of lading, bill of sale) before loading animals.
Inspect animals before loading, avoiding sick or injured individuals.
Properly load animals with clean bedding and close clean-out openings.
Double-check paperwork and gates upon completion of loading.
Log exit time and any other required information.

tasks.task: Follow biosecurity protocols for unloading animals.
subtasks: Contact the farm or ranch for admittance prior to unloading.
Follow designated route and sign in as instructed.
Verify required documents (CVI, certificate of brand inspection, bill of lading, bill of sale) with the producer.
Count and verify classes of animals unloaded.
Identify and separate any sick animals during unloading.
If possible, clean transportation equipment in a designated area to prevent spreading manure.
Thoroughly clean and disinfect the truck and trailer as soon as possible if immediate cleaning is not feasible.
Maintain clean footwear and coveralls during animal handling and around facilities.
Prevent manure from being deposited during transport by ensuring clean out areas are closed.
Collaborate with the farmer or rancher to address and treat sick animals.
Confirm the number and classes of unloaded animals for accuracy.
